events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred on the highway involving another vehicle.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident as it involves damage to a personal vehicle.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the case and assist the customer promptly.
Acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the insured, assuring them the process is underway.
Requested police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and witness statements from the insured.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the official police report and photos.
Investigation began to evaluate the circumstances of the collision and assess liability.
Investigation was completed with findings confirming the insured was not at fault.
A fair settlement was proposed to cover the repair costs and vehicle rental during repairs.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the quick and clear communication.
The claim was officially approved based on the investigation results and documentation.
Payment was issued to the customer to cover repair expenses and rental car reimbursement.
The claim was closed after confirming repairs were satisfactorily completed by the insured.
All claim documents were archived for record-keeping in compliance with company policies.
